page.title: 06Forestry and Horticulture.
page.content: Foresters are employed on the Eastnor and Bromesberrow estates, they run the woodlands on a commercial basis. The woodlands are carefully maintained and systematically replanted and are mixed hardwoods and softwoods. The softwoods including larch and spruce are felled when the hardwoods such as chestnut, oak and cherry are well established. The foresters have problems with foxes, badgers, rabbits and squirrels which have to be controlled. The Bromesberrow Nurseries produce various plants and flowers for the commercial market. Varieties include fuschias and pelegoniums, which are grown in twenty-one heated greenhouses. The Nurseries also house the largest private collection of orchids in England. The orchidist specialises in producing plants for shows, but some are sold commercially.
